title: Patrick Stewart reveals retirement from X-Men franchise
text:
Patrick Stewart has revealed he'll be leaving the X-Men franchise after Logan.
While onstage at a SiriusXM Town Hall with the film's leading man Hugh Jackman and director James Mangold, he recalled deciding to stop playing Professor X.
At the film's world premiere during this year's Berlinale: 'I realized there wil l never be a better, a more perfect, a more sensitive, emotional, and beautiful way of saying au revoir to Charles Xavier than this movie.'
Outro: Patrick Stewart has revealed he'll be hanging up the Cerebro helmet and leaving from the X-Men franchise after Logan, Entertainment Weekly reported
The 76-year-old remembered of the February 17 event: 'A week ago, Friday night in Berlin, the three of us sat, watching the movie. And I was so moved by it, much more moved than I had been the first time of seeing it.'
When he had a look at Jackman, who's also announced his departure from the franchise post-Logan, he noticed the man who played Wolverine tearing up.
At which point: 'I realized I had just done the same thing. Then, the movie ended… and we were going to be taken up on stage, but not until the credits were over.'
'I'm done too': He'd come to his conclusion during the film's world premiere at the Berlinale a week past, and told Logan's leading man Hugh Jackman, who's also leaving the franchise after the latest installment
That meant that 'we had some time to sit there and, as I sat there I realized there will never be a better, a more perfect, a more sensitive, emotional, and beautiful way of saying au revoir to Charles Xavier than this movie.'
Upon deciding to stop playing the wheelchair-bound telepath Stan Lee and Jack Kirby created in 1963, 'I told [Hugh] that same evening: "I'm done too. It’s all over."'
Stewart began portraying Xavier in the first X-Men movie, which was directed by Bryan Singer and also marked Jackman's first star turn as Wolverine.
Since 2000: Stewart began portraying Xavier in the first X-Men movie, which was directed by Bryan Singer and also marked Jackman's first star turn as Wolverine
That 2000 film was followed up by two sequels, X2: X-Men United in 2003 and X-Men: The Last Stand in 2006, both of which saw Stewart reprise the role.
After uncredited cameos in X-Men Origins: Wolverine in 2009 and The Wolverine in 2013, he returned in full by way of X-Men: Days Of Future Past in 2014.
Logan will open in British and Irish cinemas next Wednesday, before being enjoying an American release two days later.
